VAlert/title.description: Specify a title text for the component.

VAlert/text.description: Specify content text for the component.

VAlert/border.description: Adds a colored border to the component.

VAlert/border-color.description: Specifies the color of the border. Accepts any color value.

VAlert/closable.description: Adds a close icon that can hide the alert.

VAlert/close-icon.description: Change the default icon used for **closable** alerts.

VAlert/type.description: Create a specialized alert that uses a contextual color and has a pre-defined icon.

VAlert/close-label.description: Text used for *aria-label* on **closable** alerts. Can also be customized globally in [Internationalization](/customization/internationalization).

VAlert/icon.description: Apply a specific icon using the [v-icon](/components/icons/) component.

VAlert/model-value.description: Controls whether the component is visible or hidden.

VAlert/prominent.description: Displays a larger vertically centered icon to draw more attention.

VAlert/density.description: Adjusts the vertical height used by the component.

VAlert/height.description: Sets the height for the component.

VAlert/max-height.description: Sets the maximum height for the component.

VAlert/max-width.description: Sets the maximum width for the component.

VAlert/min-height.description: Sets the minimum height for the component.

VAlert/min-width.description: Sets the minimum width for the component.

VAlert/width.description: Sets the width for the component.

VAlert/elevation.description: Designates an elevation applied to the component between 0 and 24. You can find more information on the [elevation page](/styles/elevation).

VAlert/location.description: Specifies the component's location. Can combine by using a space separated string.

VAlert/position.description: Sets the position for the component.

VAlert/rounded.description: Designates the **border-radius** applied to the component. This can be **0**, **xs**, **sm**, true, **lg**, **xl**, **pill**, **circle**, and **shaped**. Find more information on available border radius classes on the [Border Radius page](/styles/border-radius).

VAlert/tag.description: Specify a custom tag used on the root element.

VAlert/theme.description: Specify a theme for this component and all of its children.

VAlert/color.description: Applies specified color to the control - supports utility colors (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). Find a list of built-in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

VAlert/variant.description: Applies a distinct style to the component.

VAlertTitle/tag.description: Specify a custom tag used on the root element.

VApp/theme.description: Specify a theme for this component and all of its children.

VAppBar/image.description: Specifies a [v-img](/components/images) as the component's background.

VAppBar/title.description: Specify a title text for the component.

VAppBar/collapse.description: Morphs the component into a collapsed state, reducing its maximum width.

VAppBar/model-value.description: The v-model value of the component. If component supports the **multiple** prop, this defaults to an empty array.

VAppBar/location.description: Aligns the component towards the top or bottom.

VAppBar/absolute.description: Applies position: absolute to the component.

VAppBar/color.description: Applies specified color to the control - supports utility colors (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). Find a list of built-in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

VAppBar/density.description: Adjusts the vertical height used by the component.

VAppBar/extended.description: Use this prop to increase the height of the toolbar _without_ using the `extension` slot for adding content. May be used in conjunction with the **extension-height** prop, and any of the other props that affect the height of the toolbar, e.g. **prominent**, **dense**, etc., **WITH THE EXCEPTION** of **height**.

VAppBar/extension-height.description: Designate an explicit height for the `extension` slot.

VAppBar/height.description: Designates a specific height for the toolbar. Overrides the heights imposed by other props, e.g. **prominent**, **dense**, **extended**, etc.

VAppBar/border.description: Designates the **border-radius** applied to the component. This can be **xs**, **sm**, **md**, **lg**, **xl**.

VAppBar/elevation.description: Designates an elevation applied to the component between 0 and 24. You can find more information on the [elevation page](/styles/elevation).

VAppBar/rounded.description: Designates the **border-radius** applied to the component. This can be **0**, **xs**, **sm**, true, **lg**, **xl**, **pill**, **circle**, and **shaped**. Find more information on available border radius classes on the [Border Radius page](/styles/border-radius).

VAppBar/tile.description: Removes any applied **border-radius** from the component.

VAppBar/tag.description: Specify a custom tag used on the root element.

VAppBar/theme.description: Specify a theme for this component and all of its children.

VAppBar/name.description: Assign a specific name for layout registration.

VAppBar/order.description: Adjust the order of the component in relation to its registration order.

VAppBar/scroll-target.description: The element to target for scrolling events. Uses `window` by default.

VAppBar/scroll-threshold.description: The amount of scroll distance down before **scroll-behavior** activates.

VAppBar/scroll-behavior.description: Specify an action to take when the scroll position of **scroll-target** reaches **scroll-threshold**. Accepts any combination of hide, inverted, collapse, elevate, and fade-image. Multiple values can be used, separated by a space.

VAppBarNavIcon/symbol.description: The [Symbol](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Symbol) used to hook into group functionality for components like [v-btn-toggle](/components/btn-toggle) and [v-bottom-navigation](/components/bottom-navigations/).

VAppBarNavIcon/flat.description: Removes the button box shadow. This is different than using the 'flat' variant.

VAppBarNavIcon/active.description: Controls the **active** state of the item. This is typically used to highlight the component.

VAppBarNavIcon/active-color.description: The applied color when the component is in an active state.

VAppBarNavIcon/base-color.description: Sets the color of component when not focused.

VAppBarNavIcon/prepend-icon.description: Creates a [v-icon](/api/v-icon/) component in the **prepend** slot before default content.

VAppBarNavIcon/append-icon.description: Creates a [v-icon](/api/v-icon/) component after default content in the **append** slot.

VAppBarNavIcon/block.description: Expands the button to 100% of available space.

VAppBarNavIcon/readonly.description: Puts the button in a readonly state. Cannot be clicked or navigated to by keyboard.

VAppBarNavIcon/stacked.description: Displays the button as a flex-column.

VAppBarNavIcon/value.description: The value used when the component is selected in a group. If not provided, a unique ID will be used.

VAppBarNavIcon/text.description: Specify content text for the component.

VAppBarNavIcon/border.description: Designates the **border-radius** applied to the component. This can be **xs**, **sm**, **md**, **lg**, **xl**.

VAppBarNavIcon/density.description: Adjusts the vertical height used by the component.

VAppBarNavIcon/height.description: Sets the height for the component.

VAppBarNavIcon/max-height.description: Sets the maximum height for the component.

VAppBarNavIcon/max-width.description: Sets the maximum width for the component.

VAppBarNavIcon/min-height.description: Sets the minimum height for the component.

VAppBarNavIcon/min-width.description: Sets the minimum width for the component.

VAppBarNavIcon/width.description: Sets the width for the component.

VAppBarNavIcon/elevation.description: Designates an elevation applied to the component between 0 and 24. You can find more information on the [elevation page](/styles/elevation).

VAppBarNavIcon/disabled.description: Removes the ability to click or target the component.

VAppBarNavIcon/selected-class.description: Configure the active CSS class applied when an item is selected.

VAppBarNavIcon/loading.description: Displays linear progress bar. Can either be a String which specifies which color is applied to the progress bar (any material color or theme color - **primary**, **secondary**, **success**, **info**, **warning**, **error**) or a Boolean which uses the component **color** (set by color prop - if it's supported by the component) or the primary color.

VAppBarNavIcon/location.description: Specifies the component's location. Can combine by using a space separated string.

VAppBarNavIcon/position.description: Sets the position for the component.

VAppBarNavIcon/rounded.description: Designates the **border-radius** applied to the component. This can be **0**, **xs**, **sm**, true, **lg**, **xl**, **pill**, **circle**, and **shaped**. Find more information on available border radius classes on the [Border Radius page](/styles/border-radius).

VAppBarNavIcon/tile.description: Removes any applied **border-radius** from the component.

VAppBarNavIcon/href.description: Designates the component as anchor and applies the **href** attribute.

VAppBarNavIcon/replace.description: Setting **replace** prop will call `router.replace()` instead of `router.push()` when clicked, so the navigation will not leave a history record. You can find more information about the [replace](https://router.vuejs.org/api/#replace) prop on the vue-router documentation.

VAppBarNavIcon/exact.description: Exactly match the link. Without this, '/' will match every route. You can find more information about the [**exact** prop](https://router.vuejs.org/api/#exact) on the vue-router documentation.

VAppBarNavIcon/to.description: Denotes the target route of the link. You can find more information about the [**to** prop](https://router.vuejs.org/api/#to) on the vue-router documentation.

VAppBarNavIcon/size.description: Sets the height and width of the component. Default unit is px. Can also use the following predefined sizes: **x-small**, **small**, **default**, **large**, and **x-large**.

VAppBarNavIcon/tag.description: Specify a custom tag used on the root element.

VAppBarNavIcon/theme.description: Specify a theme for this component and all of its children.

VAppBarNavIcon/color.description: Applies specified color to the control - supports utility colors (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). Find a list of built-in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

VAppBarNavIcon/variant.description: Applies a distinct style to the component.

VAppBarNavIcon/icon.description: Apply a specific icon using the [v-icon](/components/icons/) component. The button will become _round_.

VAppBarTitle/text.description: Specify content text for the component.

VAppBarTitle/tag.description: Specify a custom tag used on the root element.

VAutocomplete/label.description: Sets the text of the [v-label](/api/v-label/) or [v-field-label](/api/v-field-label/) component.

VAutocomplete/auto-select-first.description: When searching, will always highlight the first option and select it on blur. `exact` will only highlight and select exact matches.

VAutocomplete/clear-on-select.description: Reset the search text when a selection is made while using the **multiple** prop.

VAutocomplete/search.description: Text input used to filter items.

VAutocomplete/filter-mode.description:
Controls how the results of `customFilter` and `customKeyFilter` are combined. All modes only apply `customFilter` to columns not specified in `customKeyFilter`.

- **some**: There is at least one match from either the custom filter or the custom key filter.
- **every**: All columns match either the custom filter or the custom key filter.
- **union**: There is at least one match from the custom filter, or all columns match the custom key filters.
- **intersection**: There is at least one match from the custom filter, and all columns match the custom key filters.

VAutocomplete/no-filter.description: Do not apply filtering when searching. Useful when data is being filtered server side.

VAutocomplete/custom-filter.description: Function used to filter items, called for each filterable key on each item in the list. The first argument is the filterable value from the item, the second is the search term, and the third is the internal item object. The function should return true if the item should be included in the filtered list, or the index of the match in the value if it should be included with the result highlighted.

VAutocomplete/flat.description: Removes box shadow when using a variant with elevation.

VAutocomplete/custom-key-filter.description: Function used on specific keys within the item object. `customFilter` is skipped for columns with `customKeyFilter` specified.

VAutocomplete/filter-keys.description: Array of specific keys to filter on the item.

VAutocomplete/chips.description: Changes display of selections to chips.

VAutocomplete/closable-chips.description: Enables the [closable](/api/v-chip/#props-closable) prop on all [v-chip](/components/chips/) components.

VAutocomplete/close-text.description: Text set to to the inputs `aria-label` and `title` when input menu is closed.

VAutocomplete/open-text.description: Text set to to the inputs **aria-label** and **title** when input menu is open.

VAutocomplete/eager.description: Forces the component's content to render when it mounts. This is useful if you have content that will not be rendered in the DOM that you want crawled for SEO.

VAutocomplete/hide-no-data.description: Hides the menu when there are no options to show.  Useful for preventing the menu from opening before results are fetched asynchronously.  Also has the effect of opening the menu when the `items` array changes if not already open.

VAutocomplete/hide-selected.description: Do not display in the select menu items that are already selected.

VAutocomplete/list-props.description: Pass props through to the `v-list` component. Accepts an object with anything from [v-list](/api/v-list/#props) props, camelCase keys are recommended.

VAutocomplete/base-color.description: Sets the color of the input when it is not focused.

VAutocomplete/bg-color.description: Applies specified color to the control's background. Used on components that also support the **color** prop. - supports utility colors (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). Find a list of built-in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

VAutocomplete/disabled.description: Removes the ability to click or target the input.

VAutocomplete/multiple.description: Changes select to multiple. Accepts array for value.

VAutocomplete/density.description: Adjusts the vertical height used by the component.

VAutocomplete/max-width.description: Sets the maximum width for the component.

VAutocomplete/min-width.description: Sets the minimum width for the component.

VAutocomplete/width.description: Sets the width for the component.

VAutocomplete/items.description: Can be an array of objects or strings. By default objects should have **title** and **value** properties, and can optionally have a **props** property containing any [VListItem props](/api/v-list-item/#props). Keys to use for these can be changed with the **item-title**, **item-value**, and **item-props** props.

VAutocomplete/item-title.description: Property on supplied `items` that contains its title.

VAutocomplete/item-value.description: Property on supplied `items` that contains its value.

VAutocomplete/item-props.description: Props object that will be applied to each item component. `true` will treat the original object as raw props and pass it directly to the component.

VAutocomplete/return-object.description: Changes the selection behavior to return the object directly rather than the value specified with **item-value**.

VAutocomplete/value-comparator.description: Apply a custom comparison algorithm to compare **model-value** and values contains in the **items** prop.

VAutocomplete/rounded.description: Adds a border radius to the input.

VAutocomplete/tile.description: Removes any applied **border-radius** from the component.

VAutocomplete/theme.description: Specify a theme for this component and all of its children.

VAutocomplete/color.description: Applies specified color to the control - supports utility colors (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). Find a list of built-in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

VAutocomplete/variant.description: Applies a distinct style to the component.

VAutocomplete/menu.description: Renders with the menu open by default.

VAutocomplete/menu-props.description: Pass props through to the `v-menu` component. Accepts an object with anything from [v-menu](/api/v-menu/#props) props, camelCase keys are recommended.

VAutocomplete/id.description: Sets the DOM id on the component.

VAutocomplete/model-value.description: The v-model value of the component. If component supports the **multiple** prop, this defaults to an empty array.

VAutocomplete/transition.description: Sets the component transition. Can be one of the [built in](/styles/transitions/) or custom transition.

VAutocomplete/no-data-text.description: Text shown when no items are provided to the component.

VAutocomplete/open-on-clear.description: Open's the menu whenever the clear icon is clicked.

VAutocomplete/counter.description: Creates counter for input length; if no number is specified, it defaults to 25. Does not apply any validation.

VAutocomplete/persistent-placeholder.description: Forces placeholder to always be visible.

VAutocomplete/persistent-counter.description: Forces counter to always be visible.

VAutocomplete/role.description: The role attribute applied to the input.

VAutocomplete/append-icon.description: Creates a [v-icon](/api/v-icon/) component after default content in the **append** slot.

VAutocomplete/center-affix.description: Vertically align **appendInner**, **prependInner**, **clearIcon** and **label** in the center.

VAutocomplete/prepend-icon.description: Prepends an icon to the outnside the component's input, uses the same syntax as `v-icon`.

VAutocomplete/hide-spin-buttons.description: Hides spin buttons on the input when type is set to `number`.

VAutocomplete/hint.description: Displays hint text below the input when focused. Force this always open with the [persistent-hint](#props-persistent-hint) property.

VAutocomplete/messages.description: Displays a list of messages or a single message if using a string.

VAutocomplete/direction.description: Changes the direction of the input.

VAutocomplete/error.description: Puts the input in a manual error state.

VAutocomplete/error-messages.description: Puts the input in an error state and passes through custom error messages. Will be combined with any validations that occur from the **rules** prop. This field will not trigger validation.

VAutocomplete/max-errors.description: Control the maximum number of shown errors from validation.

VAutocomplete/rules.description: Accepts a mixed array of types `function`, `boolean` and `string`. Functions pass an input value as an argument and must return either `true` / `false` or a `string` containing an error message. The input field will enter an error state if a function returns (or any value in the array contains) `false` or is a `string`.

VAutocomplete/validate-on.type:
| 'eager'
  | 'lazy'
  | 'blur'
  | 'input'
  | 'submit'
  | 'invalid-input'
  | 'blur lazy'
  | 'input lazy'
  | 'submit lazy'
  | 'invalid-input lazy'
  | 'blur eager'
  | 'input eager'
  | 'submit eager'
  | 'invalid-input eager'
  | 'lazy blur'
  | 'lazy input'
  | 'lazy submit'
  | 'lazy invalid-input'
  | 'eager blur'
  | 'eager input'
  | 'eager submit'
  | 'eager invalid-input'
VAutocomplete/validate-on.description: Change what type of event triggers validation to run.

VAutocomplete/focused.description: Forces a focused state styling on the component.

VAutocomplete/hide-details.description: Hides hint and validation errors. When set to `auto` messages will be rendered only if there's a message (hint, error message, counter value etc) to display.

VAutocomplete/clearable.description: Allows for the component to be cleared.

VAutocomplete/clear-icon.description: The icon used when the **clearable** prop is set to true.

VAutocomplete/active.description: Controls the **active** state of the item. This is typically used to highlight the component.

VAutocomplete/persistent-clear.description: Always show the clearable icon when the input is dirty (By default it only shows on hover).

VAutocomplete/prepend-inner-icon.description: Creates a [v-icon](/api/v-icon/) component in the **prepend-inner** slot.

VAutocomplete/single-line.description: Label does not move on focus/dirty.

VAutocomplete/loading.description: Displays linear progress bar. Can either be a String which specifies which color is applied to the progress bar (any material color or theme color - **primary**, **secondary**, **success**, **info**, **warning**, **error**) or a Boolean which uses the component **color** (set by color prop - if it's supported by the component) or the primary color.

VAutocomplete/counter-value.description: Function returns the counter display text.

VBadge/bordered.description: Applies a **2px** by default and **1.5px** border around the badge when using the **dot** property.

VBadge/max.description: Sets the maximum number allowed when using the **content** prop with a `number` like value. If the content number exceeds the maximum value, a `+` suffix is added.

VCombobox/filter-mode.description:
Controls how the results of `customFilter` and `customKeyFilter` are combined. All modes only apply `customFilter` to columns not specified in `customKeyFilter`.

- **some**: There is at least one match from either the custom filter or the custom key filter.
- **every**: All columns match either the custom filter or the custom key filter.
- **union**: There is at least one match from the custom filter, or all columns match the custom key filters.
- **intersection**: There is at least one match from the custom filter, and all columns match the custom key filters.

VCombobox/custom-filter.description: Function used to filter items, called for each filterable key on each item in the list. The first argument is the filterable value from the item, the second is the search term, and the third is the internal item object. The function should return true if the item should be included in the filtered list, or the index of the match in the value if it should be included with the result highlighted.

VComponentIcon/tag.description: Specify a custom tag used on the root element.

VContainer/max-width.description: Sets the maximum width for the component.

VContainer/min-height.description: Sets the minimum height for the component.

VContainer/min-width.description: Sets the minimum width for the component.

VContainer/width.description: Sets the width for the component.

VContainer/tag.description: Specify a custom tag used on the root element.

VCounter/active.description: Determines whether the counter is visible or not.

VCounter/disabled.description: Removes the ability to click or target the component.

VDataIterator/search.description: Text input used to filter items.

VDataIterator/loading.description: If `true` and no items are provided, then a loading text will be shown.

VDataIterator/items.description: An array of strings or objects used for automatically generating children components.

VDataIterator/item-value.description: Property on supplied `items` that contains its value.

VDataIterator/item-selectable.description: Property on supplied `items` that contains the boolean value indicating if the item is selectable.

VDataIterator/return-object.description: Changes the selection behavior to return the object directly rather than the value specified with **item-value**.

VDataIterator/show-select.description: Shows the column with checkboxes for selecting items in the list.

VDataIterator/select-strategy.description: Defines the strategy of selecting items in the list. Possible values are: 'single' (only one item can be selected at a time), 'page' ('Select all' button will select only items on the current page), 'all' ('Select all' button will select all items in the list).

VDataIterator/model-value.description: The v-model value of the component. If component supports the **multiple** prop, this defaults to an empty array.

VDataIterator/value-comparator.description: Apply a custom comparison algorithm to compare **model-value** and values contains in the **items** prop.

VDataIterator/sort-by.description: Changes which item property (or properties) should be used for sort order. Can be used with `.sync` modifier.

VDataIterator/multi-sort.description: If `true` then one can sort on multiple properties.

VDataIterator/must-sort.description: If `true` then one can not disable sorting, it will always switch between ascending and descending.

VDataIterator/custom-key-sort.description: Function used on specific keys within the item object. `customSort` is skipped for columns with `customKeySort` specified.

VDataIterator/items-per-page.description: Changes how many items per page should be visible. Can be used with `.sync` modifier. Setting this prop to `-1` will display all items on the page.

VDataIterator/expand-on-click.description: Expands item when the row is clicked.

VDataIterator/expanded.description: Array of expanded items. Can be used with `.sync` modifier.

VDataIterator/group-by.description: Changes which item property should be used for grouping items. Currently only supports a single grouping in the format: `group` or `['group']`. When using an array, only the first element is considered. Can be used with `.sync` modifier.

VDataIterator/filter-mode.description:
Controls how the results of `customFilter` and `customKeyFilter` are combined. All modes only apply `customFilter` to columns not specified in `customKeyFilter`.

- **some**: There is at least one match from either the custom filter or the custom key filter.
- **every**: All columns match either the custom filter or the custom key filter.
- **union**: There is at least one match from the custom filter, or all columns match the custom key filters.
- **intersection**: There is at least one match from the custom filter, and all columns match the custom key filters.

VDataIterator/custom-key-filter.description: Function used on specific keys within the item object. `customFilter` is skipped for columns with `customKeyFilter` specified.

VDataIterator/filter-keys.description: Array of specific keys to filter on the item.

VDataIterator/tag.description: Specify a custom tag used on the root element.

| string
  | boolean
  | (TransitionProps & { component: Component })
  | { component: Component; hideOnLeave: boolean }
VDataIterator/transition.description: Sets the component transition. Can be one of the [built in](/styles/transitions/) or custom transition.

VDataTable/mobile.description: Determines the display mode of the component. If true, the component will be displayed in mobile mode. If false, the component will be displayed in desktop mode. If null, will be based on the current mobile-breakpoint

Possible values are: 'single' (only one item can be selected at a time), 'page' ('Select all' button will select only items on the current page), 'all' ('Select all' button will select all items in the list).

VDataTableVirtual/model-value.description: The v-model value of the component. If component supports the **multiple** prop, this defaults to an empty array.

VDataTableVirtual/value-comparator.description: Apply a custom comparison algorithm to compare **model-value** and values contains in the **items** prop.

VDataTableVirtual/sort-by.description: Array of column keys and sort orders that determines the sort order of the table.

VDataTableVirtual/custom-key-sort.description: Function used on specific keys within the item object. `customSort` is skipped for columns with `customKeySort` specified.

VDataTableVirtual/color.description: Applies specified color to the control - supports utility colors (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). Find a list of built-in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

VDataTableVirtual/sticky.description: Sticks the header to the top of the table.

VDataTableVirtual/sort-asc-icon.description: Icon used for ascending sort button.

VDataTableVirtual/sort-desc-icon.description: Icon used for descending sort button.

VDataTableVirtual/fixed-header.description: Use the fixed-header prop together with the height prop to fix the header to the top of the table.

VDataTableVirtual/fixed-footer.description: Use the fixed-footer prop together with the height prop to fix the footer to the bottom of the table.

VDataTableVirtual/height.description: Use the height prop to set the height of the table.

VDataTableVirtual/hover.description: Will add a hover effect to a table's row when the mouse is over it.

VDataTableVirtual/density.description: Adjusts the vertical height used by the component.

VDataTableVirtual/tag.description: Specify a custom tag used on the root element.

VDataTableVirtual/theme.description: Specify a theme for this component and all of its children.

VDataTableVirtual/item-height.description: Height in pixels of each item to display.

VDataTableVirtual/filter-mode.description:
Controls how the results of `customFilter` and `customKeyFilter` are combined. All modes only apply `customFilter` to columns not specified in `customKeyFilter`.

- **some**: There is at least one match from either the custom filter or the custom key filter.
- **every**: All columns match either the custom filter or the custom key filter.
- **union**: There is at least one match from the custom filter, or all columns match the custom key filters.
- **intersection**: There is at least one match from the custom filter, and all columns match the custom key filters.

VDataTableVirtual/custom-filter.description: Function used to filter items, called for each filterable key on each item in the list. The first argument is the filterable value from the item, the second is the search term, and the third is the internal item object. The function should return true if the item should be included in the filtered list, or the index of the match in the value if it should be included with the result highlighted.

VDataTableVirtual/custom-key-filter.description: Function used on specific keys within the item object. `customFilter` is skipped for columns with `customKeyFilter` specified.

VDataTableVirtual/filter-keys.description: Array of specific keys to filter on the item.

VDateInput/flat.description: Removes box shadow when using a variant with elevation.

VDateInput/focused.description: Forces a focused state styling on the component.

VDateInput/model-value.description: The v-model value of the component. If component supports the **multiple** prop, this defaults to an empty array.

VDateInput/color.description: Applies specified color to the control - supports utility colors (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). Find a list of built-in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

VDateInput/type.description: Determines the type of the picker - `date` for date picker, `month` for month picker.

VDateInput/counter.description: Creates counter for input length; if no number is specified, it defaults to 25. Does not apply any validation.

VDateInput/persistent-placeholder.description: Forces placeholder to always be visible.

VDateInput/persistent-counter.description: Forces counter to always be visible.

VDateInput/role.description: The role attribute applied to the input.

VDateInput/text.description: Specify content text for the component.

VDateInput/prepend-icon.description: Prepends an icon to the outnside the component's input, uses the same syntax as `v-icon`.

VDateInput/hide-spin-buttons.description: Hides spin buttons on the input when type is set to `number`.

VDateInput/hint.description: Displays hint text below the input when focused. Force this always open with the [persistent-hint](#props-persistent-hint) property.

VDateInput/messages.description: Displays a list of messages or a single message if using a string.

VDateInput/direction.description: Changes the direction of the input.

VDateInput/density.description: Adjusts the vertical height used by the component.

VDateInput/height.description: Sets the height of the input.

VDateInput/max-height.description: Sets the maximum height for the component.

VDateInput/max-width.description: Sets the maximum width for the component.

VDateInput/min-height.description: Sets the minimum height for the component.

VDateInput/min-width.description: Sets the minimum width for the component.

VDateInput/theme.description: Specify a theme for this component and all of its children.

VDateInput/disabled.description: Removes the ability to click or target the input.

VDateInput/error.description: Puts the input in a manual error state.

VDateInput/error-messages.description: Puts the input in an error state and passes through custom error messages. Will be combined with any validations that occur from the **rules** prop. This field will not trigger validation.

VDateInput/max-errors.description: Control the maximum number of shown errors from validation.

VDateInput/label.description: Sets the text of the [v-label](/api/v-label/) or [v-field-label](/api/v-field-label/) component.

VDateInput/readonly.description: Makes the picker readonly (doesn't allow to select new date).

VDateInput/rules.description: Accepts a mixed array of types `function`, `boolean` and `string`. Functions pass an input value as an argument and must return either `true` / `false` or a `string` containing an error message. The input field will enter an error state if a function returns (or any value in the array contains) `false` or is a `string`.

VDateInput/dirty.description: Manually apply the dirty state styling.

VDateInput/persistent-clear.description: Always show the clearable icon when the input is dirty (By default it only shows on hover).

VDateInput/prepend-inner-icon.description: Creates a [v-icon](/api/v-icon/) component in the **prepend-inner** slot.

VDateInput/single-line.description: Label does not move on focus/dirty.

VDateInput/variant.description: Applies a distinct style to the component.

VDateInput/loading.description: Displays linear progress bar. VDateInput/rounded.description: Adds a border radius to the input.

VDateInput/tile.description: Removes any applied **border-radius** from the component.

VDateInput/counter-value.description: Function returns the counter display text.

VDateInput/header.description: Text shown when no **display-date** is set.

VDateInput/next-icon.description: Sets the icon for next month/year button.

VDateInput/prev-icon.description: Sets the icon for previous month/year button.

VDateInput/mode-icon.description: Icon displayed next to the current month and year, toggles year selection when clicked.

VDateInput/view-mode.description: Determines which picker in the date or month picker is being displayed. Allowed values: `'month'`, `'months'`, `'year'`.

VDateInput/year.description: The current year number to show

VDateInput/hide-weekdays.description: Hide the days of the week letters.

VDateInput/show-week.description: Toggles visibility of the week numbers in the body of the calendar.

VDateInput/reverse-transition.description: The transition used when changing months into the past

VDateInput/show-adjacent-months.description: Toggles visibility of days from previous and next months.

VDateInput/weekdays.description: An array of weekdays to display.

VDateInput/weeks-in-month.description: A dynamic number of weeks in a month will grow and shrink depending on how many days are in the month. A static number always shows 7 weeks.

VDateInput/first-day-of-week.description: Sets the first day of the week, starting with 0 for Sunday.

VDateInput/allowed-dates.description: Restricts which dates can be selected.

VDateInput/display-value.description: The value that determines the month to show. This is different from modelValue, which determines the selected value.

VDateInput/multiple.description: Allow the selection of multiple dates. The **range** value selects all dates between two selections.

VDateInput/landscape.description: Puts the picker into landscape mode.

VDefaultsProvider/disabled.description: Turns off all calculations of new default values for improved performance in situations where defaults propagation isn't necessary.

VDefaultsProvider/reset.description: Reset the default values up the nested chain by {n} amount.

VDefaultsProvider/scoped.description: Prevents the ability for default values to be inherited from parent components.

VDefaultsProvider/defaults.description: Specify new default prop values for components. Keep in mind that this will be merged with previously defined values.

VDialog/retain-focus.description: Tab focus will return to the first child of the dialog by default. Disable this when using external tools that require focus such as TinyMCE or vue-clipboard.

VDialog/scrollable.description: When set to true, expects a `v-card` and a `v-card-text` component with a designated height. For more information, check out the [scrollable example](/components/dialogs#scrollable).

VDialog/absolute.description: Applies **position: absolute** to the content element.

VDialog/close-on-back.description: Closes the overlay content when the browser's back button is pressed or `$router.back()` is called, cancelling the original navigation. `persistent` overlays will cancel navigation and animate as if they were clicked outside instead of closing.

VDialog/contained.description: Limits the size of the component and scrim to its offset parent. Implies `absolute` and `attach`. (Note: The parent element must have position: relative.).

VDialog/content-class.description: Applies a custom class to the detached element. This is useful because the content is moved to the beginning of the `v-app` component (unless the **attach** prop is provided) and is not targetable by classes passed directly on the component.

VDialog/content-props.description: Apply custom properties to the content.

VDialog/disabled.description: Removes the ability to click or target the component.

VDialog/no-click-animation.description: Disables the bounce effect when clicking outside of a `v-dialog`'s content when using the **persistent** prop.

VDialog/model-value.description: The v-model value of the component. If component supports the **multiple** prop, this defaults to an empty array.

VDialog/persistent.description: Clicking outside of the element or pressing **esc** key will not deactivate it.

VDialog/scrim.description: Accepts true/false to enable background, and string to define color.

VDialog/z-index.description: The z-index used for the component.

VDialog/target.description: For locationStrategy="connected", specify an element or array of x,y coordinates that the overlay should position itself relative to. This will be the activator element by default.

VDialog/open-on-click.description: Activate the component when the activator is clicked.

VDialog/open-on-hover.description: Designates whether component should activate when its activator is hovered.

VDialog/open-on-focus.description: Activate the component when the activator is focused.

VDialog/close-on-content-click.description: Closes component when you click on its content.

VDialog/close-delay.description: Milliseconds to wait before closing component. Only applies to hover and focus events.

VDialog/open-delay.description: Milliseconds to wait before opening component. Only applies to hover and focus events.

VImg/lazy-src.description:
Something to show while waiting for the main image to load, typically a small base64-encoded thumbnail. Has a slight blur filter applied.  
NOTE: This prop has no effect unless either `height` or `aspect-ratio` are provided.

VImg/options.description: Options that are passed to the [Intersection observer](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Intersection_Observer_API) constructor.

VImg/aspect-ratio.description: Calculated as `width/height`, so for a 1920x1080px image this will be `1.7778`. Will be calculated automatically if omitted.

VImg/content-class.description: Apply a custom class to the internal content element.

Find a list of built-in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

VList/disabled.description: Puts all children inputs into a disabled state.

VList/lines.description: Designates a **minimum-height** for all children `v-list-item` components. This prop uses [line-clamp](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/-webkit-line-clamp) and is not supported in all browsers.

VList/slim.description: Reduces horizontal spacing for badges, icons, tooltips, and avatars within slim list items to create a more compact visual representation.

VList/nav.description: An alternative styling that reduces `v-list-item` width and rounds the corners. Typically used with **[v-navigation-drawer](/components/navigation-drawers)**.

VList/opened.description: An array containing the values of currently opened groups. Can be two-way bound with `v-model:opened`.

VList/activated.description: Array of ids of activated nodes.

VList/selected.description: An array containing the values of currently selected items. Can be two-way bound with `v-model:selected`.

VList/mandatory.description: Forces at least one item to always be selected (if available).

VList/active-strategy.description:
Affects how items with children behave when activated.
- **leaf:** Only leaf nodes (items without children) can be activated.
- **independent:** All nodes can be activated whether they have children or not.
- **classic:** Activating a parent node will cause all children to be activated.

VList/select-strategy.description:
Affects how items with children behave when selected.
- **leaf:** Only leaf nodes (items without children) can be selected.
- **independent:** All nodes can be selected whether they have children or not.
- **classic:** Selecting a parent node will cause all children to be selected, parent nodes will be displayed as selected if all their descendants are selected. Only leaf nodes will be added to the model.

VList/open-strategy.description:
Affects how items with children behave when expanded.
- **multiple:** Any number of groups can be open at once.
- **single:** Only one group at each level can be open, opening a group will cause others to close.
- **list:** Multiple, but all other groups will close when an item is selected.

VList/border.description: Designates the **border-radius** applied to the component. This can be **xs**, **sm**, **md**, **lg**, **xl**.

By default objects should have a **title** property, and can optionally have a **props** property containing any [VListItem props](/api/v-list-item/#props), a **value** property to allow selection, and a **children** property containing more item objects. Keys to use for these can be changed with the **item-title**, **item-value**, **item-props**, and **item-children** props.

VList/item-value.description: Property on supplied `items` that contains its value.

VList/item-children.description: Property on supplied `items` that contains its children.

VList/value-comparator.description: Apply a custom comparison algorithm to compare **model-value** and values contains in the **items** prop.

VListItem/subtitle.description: Specify a subtitle text for the component.

You can find more information about the [replace](https://router.vuejs.org/api/#replace) prop on the vue-router documentation.

Find a list of built-in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors),

VMenu/id.description: The unique identifier of the component.

VMenu/submenu.description: Opens with right arrow and closes on left instead of up/down. Implies `location="end"`. Directions are reversed for RTL.

VMenu/close-on-back.description: Closes the overlay content when the browser's back button is pressed or `$router.back()` is called, cancelling the original navigation. `persistent` overlays will cancel navigation and animate as if they were clicked outside instead of closing.

VMenu/contained.description: Limits the size of the component and scrim to its offset parent. Implies `absolute` and `attach`. (Note: The parent element must have position: relative.).

VMenu/content-class.description: Applies a custom class to the detached element. This is useful because the content is moved to the beginning of the `v-app` component (unless the **attach** prop is provided) and is not targetable by classes passed directly on the component.

VMenu/content-props.description: Apply custom properties to the content.

VMenu/disabled.description: Removes the ability to click or target the component.

VMenu/no-click-animation.description: Disables the bounce effect when clicking outside of the content element when using the persistent prop.

VMenu/model-value.description: The v-model value of the component. If component supports the **multiple** prop, this defaults to an empty array.

VMenu/persistent.description: Clicking outside of the element or pressing esc key will not deactivate it.

VMenu/scrim.description: Accepts true/false to enable background, and string to define color.

VMenu/z-index.description: The z-index used for the component.

VMenu/target.description: For locationStrategy="connected", specify an element or array of x,y coordinates that the overlay should position itself relative to. This will be the activator element by default.

VMenu/activator-props.description: Apply custom properties to the activator.

VMenu/open-on-click.description: Designates whether menu should open on activator click.

VMenu/open-on-hover.description: Designates whether menu should open on activator hover.

VMenu/open-on-focus.description: Activate the component when the activator is focused.

VMenu/close-on-content-click.description: Designates if menu should close when its content is clicked.

VMenu/close-delay.description: Milliseconds to wait before closing component. Only works with the **open-on-hover** prop.

VMenu/open-delay.description: Milliseconds to wait before opening component. Only works with the **open-on-hover** prop.

VMenu/height.description: Sets the height for the component.

VMenu/max-height.description: Sets the maximum height for the component.

VMenu/max-width.description: Sets the maximum width for the component.

VMenu/min-height.description: Sets the minimum height for the component.

VMenu/min-width.description: Sets the minimum width for the component. Use `auto` to use the activator width.

VMenu/width.description: Sets the width for the component.

VMenu/eager.description: Forces the component's content to render when it mounts. This is useful if you have content that will not be rendered in the DOM that you want crawled for SEO.

VMenu/location-strategy.description: A function used to specifies how the component should position relative to its activator.

VMenu/location.description: Specifies the anchor point for positioning the component, using directional cues to align it either horizontally, vertically, or both..

VMenu/origin.description: Sets the transition origin on the element. You can find more information on the MDN documentation [for transition origin](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/transform-origin).

VMenu/offset.description: A single value that offsets content away from the target based upon what side it is on.

VMenu/scroll-strategy.description: Strategy used when the component is activate and user scrolls.

VMenu/theme.description: Specify a theme for this component and all of its children.

| string
  | boolean
  | (TransitionProps & { component: Component })
  | { component: Component }
VMenu/transition.description: Sets the component transition. Can be one of the [built in](/styles/transitions/) or custom transition.

VMenu/attach.description: Specifies which DOM element the overlay content should teleport to. Can be a direct element reference, querySelector string, or `true` to disable teleporting. Uses `body` by default. Generally not recommended except as a last resort: the default positioning algorithm should handle most scenarios better than is possible without teleporting, and you may have unexpected behavior if the menu ends up as child of its activator.

VMessages/active.description: Determines whether the messages are visible or not.

VMessages/color.description: Applies specified color to the control - supports utility colors (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). Find a list of built-in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

VMessages/messages.description: Displays a list of messages or a single message if using a string.

| string
  | boolean

VMessages/transition.description: Sets the component transition. Can be one of the [built in](/styles/transitions/) or custom transition.

VNavigationDrawer/image.description: Apply a specific background image to the component.

VNavigationDrawer/color.description: Applies specified color to the control - supports utility colors (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). Find a list of built-in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

VNavigationDrawer/disable-resize-watcher.description: Prevents the automatic opening or closing of the drawer when resized, based on whether the device is mobile or desktop.

VNavigationDrawer/disable-route-watcher.description: Disables opening of navigation drawer when route changes.

VNavigationDrawer/expand-on-hover.description: Collapses the drawer to a **mini-variant** until hovering with the mouse.

VNavigationDrawer/floating.description: A floating drawer has no visible container (no border-right).

VNavigationDrawer/model-value.description: The v-model value of the component. If component supports the **multiple** prop, this defaults to an empty array.

VNavigationDrawer/permanent.description: The drawer remains visible regardless of screen size.

VNavigationDrawer/rail.description: Sets the component width to the **rail-width** value.

VNavigationDrawer/rail-width.description: Sets the width for the component when `rail` is enabled.

VNavigationDrawer/scrim.description: Determines whether an overlay is used when a **temporary** drawer is open. Accepts true/false to enable background, and string to define color.

VNavigationDrawer/temporary.description: A temporary drawer sits above its application and uses a scrim (overlay) to darken the background.

VNavigationDrawer/persistent.description: Clicking outside or pressing **esc** key will not dismiss the dialog.

VNavigationDrawer/width.description: Sets the width for the component.

VNavigationDrawer/location.description: Controls the edge of the screen the drawer is attached to.

VNavigationDrawer/border.description: Designates the **border-radius** applied to the component. This can be **xs**, **sm**, **md**, **lg**, **xl**.

VNavigationDrawer/close-delay.description: Milliseconds to wait before closing component. Only applies to hover and focus events.

VNavigationDrawer/open-delay.description: Milliseconds to wait before opening component. Only applies to hover and focus events.

VNavigationDrawer/mobile.description: Determines the display mode of the component. If true, the component will be displayed in mobile mode. If false, the component will be displayed in desktop mode. If null, will be based on the current mobile-breakpoint

VNavigationDrawer/mobile-breakpoint.description: Sets the designated mobile breakpoint for the component. This will apply alternate styles for mobile devices such as the `temporary` prop, or activate the `bottom` prop when the breakpoint value is met. Setting the value to `0` will disable this functionality.

VNavigationDrawer/elevation.description: Designates an elevation applied to the component between 0 and 24. You can find more information on the [elevation page](/styles/elevation).

VNumberInput/max-errors.description: Control the maximum number of shown errors from validation.

VNumberInput/rules.description: Accepts a mixed array of types `function`, `boolean` and `string`. The input field will enter an error state if a function returns (or any value in the array contains) `false` or is a `string`.

VOverlay/absolute.description: Applies **position: absolute** to the content element.

VOverlay/close-on-back.description: Closes the overlay content when the browser's back button is pressed or `$router.back()` is called, cancelling the original navigation. `persistent` overlays will cancel navigation and animate as if they were clicked outside instead of closing.

VOverlay/contained.description: Limits the size of the component and scrim to its offset parent. Implies `absolute` and `attach`. (Note: The parent element must have position: relative.).

VOverlay/content-class.description: Applies a custom class to the detached element. This is useful because the content is moved to the beginning of the `v-app` component (unless the **attach** prop is provided) and is not targetable by classes passed directly on the component.

VOverlay/content-props.description: Apply custom properties to the content.

VOverlay/disabled.description: Removes the ability to click or target the component.

VOverlay/no-click-animation.description: Disables the bounce effect when clicking outside of the content element when using the persistent prop.

VOverlay/persistent.description: Clicking outside of the element or pressing esc key will not deactivate it.

VOverlay/scrim.description: Accepts true/false to enable background, and string to define color.

VOverlay/z-index.description: The z-index used for the component.

VOverlay/target.description: For locationStrategy="connected", specify an element or array of x,y coordinates that the overlay should position itself relative to. This will be the activator element by default.

VOverlay/activator-props.description: Apply custom properties to the activator.

VOverlay/open-on-click.description: Activate the component when the activator is clicked.

VOverlay/open-on-focus.description: Activate the component when the activator is focused.

VOverlay/close-on-content-click.description: Closes component when you click on its content.

VOverlay/close-delay.description: Milliseconds to wait before closing component. Only applies to hover and focus events.

VOverlay/open-delay.description: Milliseconds to wait before opening component. Only applies to hover and focus events.

VOverlay/height.description: Sets the height for the component.

VOverlay/min-width.description: Sets the minimum width for the component.

VOverlay/width.description: Sets the width for the component.

VOverlay/eager.description: Forces the component's content to render when it mounts. This is useful if you have content that will not be rendered in the DOM that you want crawled for SEO.

VOverlay/location-strategy.description: A function used to specifies how the component should position relative to its activator.

VOverlay/scroll-strategy.description: Strategy used when the component is activate and user scrolls.

VOverlay/theme.description: Specify a theme for this component and all of its children.

VOverlay/transition.description: Sets the component transition. Can be one of the [built in](/styles/transitions/) or custom transition.

VOverlay/attach.description: Specifies which DOM element the overlay content should teleport to. Can be a direct element reference, querySelector string, or `true` to disable teleporting. Uses `body` by default.

VRangeSlider/hide-details.description: Hides hint and validation errors. When set to `auto` messages will be rendered only if there's a message (hint, error message, counter value etc) to display.

VRangeSlider/step.description: If greater than 0, sets step interval for ticks.

VRangeSlider/thumb-color.description: Sets the thumb and thumb label color.

VRangeSlider/thumb-label.description: Show thumb label. If `true` it shows label when using slider. If set to `'always'` it always shows label.

VRangeSlider/thumb-size.description: Controls the size of the thumb label.

VRangeSlider/show-ticks.description: Show track ticks. If `true` it shows ticks when using slider. If set to `'always'` it always shows ticks.

VRangeSlider/ticks.description: Show track ticks. If `true` it shows ticks when using slider. If set to `'always'` it always shows ticks.

VRangeSlider/color.description: Applies specified color to the control - supports utility colors (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). Find a list of built-in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

VRangeSlider/rounded.description: Designates the **border-radius** applied to the component. This can be **0**, **xs**, **sm**, true, **lg**, **xl**, **pill**, **circle**, and **shaped**. Find more information on available border radius classes on the [Border Radius page](/styles/border-radius).

VRangeSlider/tile.description: Removes any applied **border-radius** from the component.

VRangeSlider/elevation.description: Designates an elevation applied to the component between 0 and 24. You can find more information on the [elevation page](/styles/elevation).

VRangeSlider/strict.description: Disallows dragging the ending thumb past the starting thumb and vice versa.

VRating/length.description: The amount of items to show.

VRating/active-color.description: The applied color when the component is in an active state.

VRating/color.description: Applies specified color to the control - supports utility colors (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). Find a list of built-in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

VRating/clearable.description: Allows for the component to be cleared by clicking on the current value.

VRating/disabled.description: Removes the ability to click or target the component.

VRating/half-increments.description: Allows the selection of half increments.

VRating/hover.description: Provides visual feedback when hovering over icons.

VRating/readonly.description: Removes all hover effects and pointer events.

VRating/model-value.description: The v-model value of the component. If component supports the **multiple** prop, this defaults to an empty array.

VRating/item-label-position.description: Position of item labels. Accepts 'top' and 'bottom'.

VRating/density.description: Adjusts the vertical height used by the component.

VRating/size.description: Sets the height and width of the component. Default unit is px. Can also use the following predefined sizes: **x-small**, **small**, **default**, **large**, and **x-large**.

VRating/tag.description: Specify a custom tag used on the root element.

VRating/theme.description: Specify a theme for this component and all of its children.

VRating/item-labels.description: Array of labels to display next to each item..

VResponsive/aspect-ratio.description: Sets a base aspect ratio, calculated as width/height. This will only set a **minimum** height, the component can still grow if it has a lot of content.

VResponsive/content-class.description: Apply a custom class to the internal content element.

VResponsive/inline.description: Display as an inline element instead of a block, also disables flex-grow.

VResponsive/height.description: Sets the height for the component.

VResponsive/max-height.description: Sets the maximum height for the component.

VResponsive/max-width.description: Sets the maximum width for the component.

VResponsive/min-height.description: Sets the minimum height for the component.

VResponsive/min-width.description: Sets the minimum width for the component.

VResponsive/width.description: Sets the width for the component.

VRow/align-md.description: Changes the **align-items** property on medium and greater breakpoints.

VRow/align-lg.description: Changes the **align-items** property on large and greater breakpoints.

VRow/align-xl.description: Changes the **align-items** property on extra large and greater breakpoints.

VRow/tag.description: Specify a custom tag used on the root element.

VScaleTransition/leave-absolute.description: Absolutely positions the leaving element (useful for [FLIP](https://aerotwist.com/blog/flip-your-animations/)).

VSelect/label.description: Sets the text of the [v-label](/api/v-label/) or [v-field-label](/api/v-field-label/) component.

VSelect/chips.description: Changes display of selections to chips.

VSelect/closable-chips.description: Enables the [closable](/api/v-chip/#props-closable) prop on all [v-chip](/components/chips/) components.

VSelect/close-text.description: Text set to to the inputs `aria-label` and `title` when input menu is closed.

VSelect/open-text.description: Text set to to the inputs **aria-label** and **title** when input menu is open.

VSelect/eager.description: Forces the component's content to render when it mounts. This is useful if you have content that will not be rendered in the DOM that you want crawled for SEO.

VSelect/hide-no-data.description: Hides the menu when there are no options to show.  Useful for preventing the menu from opening before results are fetched asynchronously.  Also has the effect of opening the menu when the `items` array changes if not already open.

VSelect/hide-selected.description: Do not display in the select menu items that are already selected.

VSelect/list-props.description: Pass props through to the `v-list` component. Accepts an object with anything from [v-list](/api/v-list/#props) props, camelCase keys are recommended.

VSelect/base-color.description: Sets the color of the input when it is not focused.

VSelect/bg-color.description: Applies specified color to the control's background. Used on components that also support the **color** prop. - supports utility colors (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). Find a list of built-in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

VSelect/disabled.description: Removes the ability to click or target the input.

VSelect/multiple.description: Changes select to multiple. Accepts array for value.

VSelect/flat.description: Removes box shadow when using a variant with elevation.

VSelect/density.description: Adjusts the vertical height used by the component.

VSelect/max-width.description: Sets the maximum width for the component.

VSelect/min-width.description: Sets the minimum width of the select's `v-menu` content.

VSelect/width.description: Sets the width for the component.

VSelect/items.description: Can be an array of objects or strings. By default objects should have **title** and **value** properties, and can optionally have a **props** property containing any [VListItem props](/api/v-list-item/#props). Keys to use for these can be changed with the **item-title**, **item-value**, and **item-props** props.

VSelect/item-title.description: Property on supplied `items` that contains its title.

VSelect/item-value.description: Set property of **items**'s value - **must be primitive**. Dot notation is supported. **Note:** This is currently not supported with `v-combobox` [GitHub Issue](https://github.com/vuetifyjs/vuetify/issues/5479).

VSelect/item-props.description: Props object that will be applied to each item component. `true` will treat the original object as raw props and pass it directly to the component.

VSelect/return-object.description: Changes the selection behavior to return the object directly rather than the value specified with **item-value**.

VSelect/value-comparator.description: Apply a custom comparison algorithm to compare **model-value** and values contains in the **items** prop.

VSelect/rounded.description: Adds a border radius to the input.

VSelect/tile.description: Removes any applied **border-radius** from the component.

VSelect/theme.description: Specify a theme for this component and all of its children.

VSelect/color.description: Applies specified color to the control - supports utility colors (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). Find a list of built-in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

VSelect/variant.description: Applies a distinct style to the component.

VSelect/menu.description: Renders with the menu open by default.

VSelect/menu-props.description: Pass props through to the `v-menu` component. Accepts an object with anything from [v-menu](/api/v-menu/#props) props, camelCase keys are recommended.

VSelect/id.description: Sets the DOM id on the component.

VSelect/model-value.description: The v-model value of the component. If component supports the **multiple** prop, this defaults to an empty array.

VSelect/transition.type:
| string
  | boolean
  | (TransitionProps & { component: Component })
  | { component: Component }
VSelect/transition.description: Sets the component transition. Can be one of the [built in](/styles/transitions/) or custom transition.

VSelect/no-data-text.description: Text shown when no items are provided to the component.

VSelect/open-on-clear.description: When using the **clearable** prop, once cleared, the select menu will either open or stay open, depending on the current state.

VSelect/counter.description: Creates counter for input length; if no number is specified, it defaults to 25. Does not apply any validation.

VSelect/persistent-placeholder.description: Forces placeholder to always be visible.

VSelect/persistent-counter.description: Forces counter to always be visible.

VSelect/role.description: The role attribute applied to the input.

VSelect/append-icon.description: Creates a [v-icon](/api/v-icon/) component after default content in the **append** slot.

VSelect/center-affix.description: Vertically align **appendInner**, **prependInner**, **clearIcon** and **label** in the center.

VSelect/prepend-icon.description: Prepends an icon to the outnside the component's input, uses the same syntax as `v-icon`.

VSelect/hide-spin-buttons.description: Hides spin buttons on the input when type is set to `number`.

VSelect/hint.description: Displays hint text below the input when focused. Force this always open with the [persistent-hint](#props-persistent-hint) property.

VSelect/messages.description: Displays a list of messages or a single message if using a string.

VSelect/direction.description: Changes the direction of the input.

VSelect/error.description: Puts the input in a manual error state.

VSelect/error-messages.description: Puts the input in an error state and passes through custom error messages. Will be combined with any validations that occur from the **rules** prop. This field will not trigger validation.

VSelect/max-errors.description: Control the maximum number of shown errors from validation.

VSelect/rules.description: Accepts a mixed array of types `function`, `boolean` and `string`. Functions pass an input value as an argument and must return either `true` / `false` or a `string` containing an error message. The input field will enter an error state if a function returns (or any value in the array contains) `false` or is a `string`.

VSelect/focused.description: Forces a focused state styling on the component.

VSelect/hide-details.description: Hides hint and validation errors. When set to `auto` messages will be rendered only if there's a message (hint, error message, counter value etc) to display.

VSelect/clearable.description: Allows for the component to be cleared.

VSelect/clear-icon.description: The icon used when the **clearable** prop is set to true.

VSelect/active.description: Controls the **active** state of the item. This is typically used to highlight the component.

VSelect/persistent-clear.description: Always show the clearable icon when the input is dirty (By default it only shows on hover).

VSelect/prepend-inner-icon.description: Creates a [v-icon](/api/v-icon/) component in the **prepend-inner** slot.

VSelect/single-line.description: Label does not move on focus/dirty.

VSelect/loading.description: Displays linear progress bar. Can either be a String which specifies which color is applied to the progress bar (any material color or theme color - **primary**, **secondary**, **success**, **info**, **warning**, **error**) or a Boolean which uses the component **color** (set by color prop - if it's supported by the component) or the primary color.

VSelect/counter-value.description: Function returns the counter display text.

VSelectionControl/base-color.description: Sets the color of the input when it is not focused.

VSelectionControl/value.description: The value used when the component is selected in a group. If not provided, a unique ID will be used.

VSelectionControl/inline.description: Puts children inputs into a row.

VSkeletonLoader/boilerplate.description: Remove the loading animation from the skeleton.

VSkeletonLoader/color.description: Applies specified color to the control - supports utility colors (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). Find a list of built-in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

VSkeletonLoader/loading.description: Applies a loading animation with a on-hover loading cursor. A value of **false** will only work when there is content in the `default` slot.

VSkeletonLoader/loading-text.description: aria-label for the element in a loading state.

VSkeletonLoader/type.description: A string delimited list of skeleton components to create such as `type="text@3"` or `type="card, list-item"`. Will recursively generate a corresponding skeleton from the provided string. Also supports short-hand for multiple elements such as **article@3** and **paragraph@2** which will generate 3 _article_ skeletons and 2 _paragraph_ skeletons. Please see below for a list of available pre-defined options.

VSkeletonLoader/height.description: Sets the height for the component.

VSkeletonLoader/max-height.description: Sets the maximum height for the component.

VSkeletonLoader/max-width.description: Sets the maximum width for the component.

VSkeletonLoader/min-height.description: Sets the minimum height for the component.

VSkeletonLoader/min-width.description: Sets the minimum width for the component.

VSlideGroup/symbol.description: The [Symbol](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Symbol) used to hook into group functionality for components like [v-btn-toggle](/components/btn-toggle) and [v-bottom-navigation](/components/bottom-navigations/).

VSlideGroup/center-active.description: Forces the selected component to be centered.

VSlideGroup/direction.description: Switch between horizontal and vertical modes.

VSlideGroup/next-icon.description: The appended slot when arrows are shown.

VSlideGroup/prev-icon.description: The prepended slot when arrows are shown.

VSlideGroup/show-arrows.description: Change when the overflow arrow indicators are shown. By **default**, arrows *always* display on Desktop when the container is overflowing. When the container overflows on mobile, arrows are not shown by default. A **show-arrows** value of `true` allows these arrows to show on Mobile if the container overflowing. A value of `desktop` *always* displays arrows on Desktop while a value of `mobile` always displays arrows on Mobile. A value of `always` always displays arrows on Desktop *and* Mobile. Find more information on how to customize breakpoint thresholds on the [breakpoints page](/customizing/breakpoints).

VSlideGroup/mobile.description: Determines the display mode of the component. If true, the component will be displayed in mobile mode. If false, the component will be displayed in desktop mode. If null, will be based on the current mobile-breakpoint

VSlideGroup/mobile-breakpoint.description: Sets the designated mobile breakpoint for the component.

VSlideGroup/tag.description: Specify a custom tag used on the root element.

VSlideGroup/model-value.description: The v-model value of the component. If component supports the **multiple** prop, this defaults to an empty array.

VSlideGroup/multiple.description: Allows one to select multiple items.

VSlideGroup/max.description: Sets a maximum number of selections that can be made.

VSlideGroup/selected-class.description: Configure the active CSS class applied when an item is selected.

VSlideGroup/disabled.description: Puts all children components into a disabled state.

VSlideGroup/mandatory.description: Forces at least one item to always be selected (if available).

VSlideGroupItem/value.description: The value used when the component is selected in a group. If not provided, a unique ID will be used.

VSlideGroupItem/disabled.description: Removes the ability to click or target the component.

VSlideGroupItem/selected-class.description: Configure the active CSS class applied when an item is selected.

VSlideXReverseTransition/disabled.description: Removes the ability to click or target the component.
